item.title: Isle of Man Tests Blockchain Prototype for IoT - CoinDesk
item.description:
Isle of Man Tests Blockchain Prototype for IoT - CoinDesk

The government of the Isle of Man has announced its latest blockchain proof-of-concept. Profiled today in Financial News , the project is a collaboration with blockchain startup Credits that finds the two partners exploring whether the technology can be used to help keep Internet of Things (IoT) devices from being compromised.

item.title: Dash Across America: Why We Do What We Do and Run-ins with the Cops on the Way to Jackalope
item.description:
Dash Across America: Why We Do What We Do and Run-ins with the Cops on the Way to Jackalope

In this edition of SovereignBTC, the Blush Family is on their Dash Across America road trip heading to Arizona for the Jacakalope Freedom Festival when they have a couple run-ins with the police. John and Cat also share how they got in to crypto-currency and bitcoin and why they regularly embark on crypto only road trips.

item.title: Hacked Bitcoin exchange Bitfinex will reduce balances by 36% to distribute losses amongst all users
item.description:
Hacked Bitcoin exchange Bitfinex will reduce balances by 36% to distribute losses amongst all users

Late last week we reported that Bitfinex, a popular Hong Kong-based Bitcoin exchange was hacked, losing about $70M worth of customer's bitcoin. The loss caused the price of Bitcoin to drop about 20%, and it still hasn't fully recovered to pre-hack levels.

item.title: Do I need to pay taxes if I sit on (do not use) bitcoins?
item.description:
Do I need to pay taxes if I sit on (do not use) bitcoins?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top I've done some reading on the IRS bitcoin guidelines and I'm a bit confused how the capital gains taxes works.

item.title: US District Judge Makes Critical Claims About Tor's Security - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
US District Judge Makes Critical Claims About Tor's Security - Bitcoinist.net

During a hearing in Tacoma, Washington, a US District Court Judge made some critical comments regarding the security of the anonymity software, Tor. Also read: Crooked Silk Road Agent's Lawyer: Appeal is Frivolous US district judge, Robert J. Bryan, made public record some thoughts he had regarding Tor.

item.title: What Is Bitcoin's Barry Silbert Doing?
item.description:
What Is Bitcoin's Barry Silbert Doing?

I continue to believe strongly, and publicly state whenever convenient to do so, that Barry Silbert's "Ethereum Classic" scam is, well, a scam. I try to honor as many different beliefs and views as humanly possible - that's part of what being a researcher, journalist, and investor entails in the 21st century.

item.title: Bitfinex users to share 36% of bitcoin losses after hack - BBC News
item.description:
Bitfinex users to share 36% of bitcoin losses after hack - BBC News

People who stored bitcoins at a popular exchange have been told they will lose 36% of their assets following a cyber-attack. Hong Kong-based Bitfinex, where many users had stored the virtual currency to be used in transactions, said it lost up to $65m (Â£49m) in an attack.

item.title: U.S. to auction $16 million worth of bitcoin from various cases
item.description:
U.S. to auction $16 million worth of bitcoin from various cases

Technology | Mon Aug 8, 2016 10:21am EDT NEW YORK The U.S. government said on Monday it plans to auction over 2,700 bitcoin that were forfeited during several cases, including the prosecution of the creator of the online black market known as Silk Road. The U.S.

item.title: President Trump Would Stop New Financial Regulation in the US
item.description:
President Trump Would Stop New Financial Regulation in the US

Donald Trump will confirm his intention to halt further financial regulation in the US until "significant growth" occurs. Also read: Will Donald Trump's Trade Policies Cause Bitcoin to Soar? In his forthcoming economic speech in Detroit later today, the Republican nominee will criticize the Obama administration's "record-breaking pace of new regulations, tax increases, restrictions on private-energy production, and one-sided trade deals."
